intro: Peckia boissieri, commonly known as the mountain peckia, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in a fine layer of hairs, while its flowers are small and yellowish-white in color. Peckia boissieri is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in rock gardens or alpine settings.
